_comment: - How versions are calculated from commits.
- How Git tags and GitHub Releases are named.
- Which files get their version fields updated by the Release PR.
- The GitHub Actions workflow at `.github/workflows/release-please.yml` runs `googleapis/release-please-action` and points to this config.
_comment_releaseType: Top-level default release strategy. `simple` is a general-purpose strategy that updates a changelog and bumps versions based on commits.
_comment_includeV: If true, tags are prefixed with `v` (e.g. `v1.2.3`). This matches the packaging workflow trigger in `.github/workflows/nuget-package.yml` which listens for tags `v*`.
_comment_includeComponent: If true, tags include the package/component name (useful for monorepos). This repo uses a single component so it is disabled.

.._comment_packageRoot: Per-package config. The key `.` means the repository root is treated as the package.
.._comment_changelogPath: The changelog file that Release Please will update in the Release PR.

extra-files._comment: Also update the `<Version>` element in the project file so the produced NuGet package version matches the release tag.
Also update the Unity package version (`package.json` -> `version`) so the UPM package aligns with the release tag.
